messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the RESTEasy/JAX-RS on Netty (resteasy-netty4) for a Java-based REST API framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/K8OperatorResources.java`, I found that `com.datastax.mgmtapi.resources.K8OperatorResources.checkLiveness` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/api/v0/probes/liveness`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Analysis summary for K8OperatorResources.checkLiveness

- Full HTTP request path: /api/v0/probes/liveness
  - Rationale: The class has a base path @Path("/api/v0"), and the method checkLiveness is annotated with @Path("/probes/liveness"). No path parameters are present, so the full path is exactly /api/v0/probes/liveness.

- All HTTP methods acceptable: false
  - Rationale: The endpoint method is annotated only with @GET, so not all HTTP methods are supported.

- HEAD: false
  - Rationale: There is no @HEAD method defined for this endpoint, and the code only declares GET.

- POST: false
  - Rationale: The checkLiveness endpoint itself is only annotated with @GET; there is no POST variant for /api/v0/probes/liveness.

- OPTIONS: false
  - Rationale: No @OPTIONS handler is defined for this endpoint.

- TRACE: false
  - Rationale: No TRACE handler defined for this endpoint.

- GET: true
  - Rationale: The method checkLiveness is annotated with @GET and returns 200 OK ("OK") when invoked.

- PUT: false
  - Rationale: No PUT handler defined for this endpoint.

- DELETE: false
  - Rationale: No DELETE handler defined for this endpoint.

- PATCH: false
  - Rationale: No PATCH handler defined for this endpoint.

Explanation
- The endpoint is defined only for HTTP GET at path /api/v0/probes/liveness due to the @GET and @Path("/probes/liveness") annotations in a class with @Path("/api/v0"). There are no corresponding annotations (@HEAD, @POST, @PUT, @DELETE, @PATCH, @OPTIONS, @TRACE) for this specific path, so only GET is acceptable. Any assumptions about automatic handling of HEAD or OPTIONS by the framework are not used here; the code does not declare those methods, so we report them as not acceptable per code.
